headline: Facts And Fact Checking Fact Check Was Kamala Harris Wearing Audio Earrings During Debate
summary: Shortly after Tuesday night’s presidential debate hosted byABC News (Lean Left bias), a theory that Vice President Kamala Harris was wearing audio earrings to gain an unfair advantage spread virally. There's no hard evidence that she was.The Details:Right-wing voices likeAlex JonesandLaura Loomerwere among the most prominent who suggested Harris may have been wearing Icebach Sound’sNova H1 Audio Earrings. Other userspointed outthat Harris was apparently wearing a pair of Tiffany earrings that she hadworn many timesbefore.Key Quote:Icebach toldJust The News (Lean Right bias), “We do not know whether Mrs. Harris wore one of our products. The resemblance is striking.” The company also added some humor in its statement, adding, “We are currently developing a male version and will soon be able to offer it to the Trump campaign. The choice of colour is a bit challenging though as orange does not go well with a lot of colours.”Non-Quotes:Forbes (Center bias)andFactCheck.org (Lean Left bias)reported that the Harris campaign declined to comment. Forbes said Tiffany and ABC News did not reply to requests for comment.How The Media Covered It:FactCheck.org included context on similar right-wing conspiracies that arose in 2016 and 2020, suggesting Democratic candidates wore earpieces during debates. Just The News founder John Solomon cast doubt on the idea that Harris was wearing audio earrings during aWednesday broadcast, in which he cited seeing previous times she’d made many speaking errors while wearing the same earrings.
